biography:
Tetsuya Watari (December 28, 1941 – August 10, 2020) was a Japanese stage, film, and television actor. He made his screen debut in 1964, in Isamu Kosugi's Abare Kishidō  He was the president of Ishihara Promotion.

He has a younger brother, Tsunehiko Watase, who is also an actor.
